snippet: Even though Senate Democrats reached agreement on a $110 billion mix of tax increases and spending cuts, the chances of a deal to head off automatic spending cuts have still receded.
abstract: Senate Democrats reach agreement on $110 billion mix of tax increases and spending cuts to head off automatic spending cuts through end of 2013, but chances of deal before March 1 deadline have receded.
lead_paragraph: Even though Senate Democrats reached agreement on a $110 billion mix of tax increases and spending cuts, the chances of a deal to head off automatic spending cuts have still receded.

headline.seo: Senate Democrats Make Their Move on Budget Deal
headline.main: Senate Democrats Offer a Proposal to Head Off Automatic Cuts
headline.print_headline: Senate Democrats Offer a Proposal to Head Off Automatic Cuts
